questions.prompt: 1. In BG 15.1, what is the cosmic tree (ashvattha) described in this chapter?
choices: A metaphorical tree with roots in Brahman and branches in the material world
questions.feedback: Krishna describes an inverted ashvattha tree representing the cosmic manifestation.

questions.prompt: 2. In BG 15.1-2, why is the ashvattha tree inverted?
choices: Its roots are above (in the spiritual world) and branches below (in the material world)
questions.feedback: The inverted tree shows that the spiritual is the root and material is the manifestation.

questions.prompt: 3. In BG 15.3, what sustains the cosmic tree?
choices: The Vedas, austerity, and sense enjoyment; the tree is sustained by the modes of nature
questions.feedback: The cosmic tree is sustained by the three modes of material nature.

questions.prompt: 4. In BG 15.4, what are the branches of this cosmic tree?
choices: The Vedas and the material manifestations; they extend both upward and downward
questions.feedback: The branches represent both the Vedas (knowledge) and material manifestations.

questions.prompt: 5. In BG 15.5, how does one become free from this cosmic tree?
choices: By cutting the strong roots with the weapon of detachment and knowing Krishna as the ultimate source
questions.feedback: One must recognize Krishna's supremacy and cut bonds of attachment to the material tree.

questions.prompt: 6. In BG 15.6-7, what is the path to the spiritual world?
choices: Knowing Krishna as the Purusottama (Supreme Personality); one reaches His eternal abode
questions.feedback: Krishna is the Supreme Personality; reaching Him is the goal of spiritual life.

questions.prompt: 7. In BG 15.7, what are the characteristics of Krishna's eternal abode?
choices: Nitya (eternal), Sat-chit-ananda (eternal bliss and knowledge), beyond the sun's illumination
questions.feedback: Krishna's abode is eternal, blissful, and the supreme destination of the pure.

questions.prompt: 8. In BG 15.8, what jiva (living entity) can reach Krishna?
choices: The jiva who surrenders to Krishna and worships Him with all strength
questions.feedback: Those who engage in pure devotional service reach Krishna's eternal abode.

questions.prompt: 9. In BG 15.9-11, what are the two categories of living entities in the universe?
choices: Kshara (perishable, changeable living beings) and Akshara (unchangeable, eternal)
questions.feedback: Krishna divides all entities into perishable and imperishable categories.

questions.prompt: 10. In BG 15.12-13, where does Krishna's illumination manifest?
choices: In the sun, moon, and fire; through Krishna's energy
questions.feedback: Krishna's energy illuminates all sources of light in the universe.

questions.prompt: 11. In BG 15.14, what sustains all beings?
choices: Krishna, who becomes the digestive fire and digests all food within all beings
questions.feedback: Krishna as the life force enables digestion and sustains all living beings.

questions.prompt: 12. In BG 15.14 (from purport), what is Krishna's role as the digestive fire?
choices: The metabolic energy in all beings; Krishna is the source of all energies
questions.feedback: Krishna is the living force that enables all bodily functions, including digestion.

questions.prompt: 13. In BG 15.15, where is Krishna present?
choices: In the hearts of all living beings; in everyone's heart
questions.feedback: Krishna is the Supreme Soul (Paramatma) dwelling in every heart as the Witness.

questions.prompt: 14. In BG 15.15 (from purport), what does Krishna being in all hearts enable?
choices: He witnesses all actions and sustains consciousness in all beings
questions.feedback: As Paramatma in the heart, Krishna is the witness and sustainer of all existence.

questions.prompt: 15. In BG 15.16-17, who is the Purusottama (Supreme Personality)?
choices: Krishnaâ€”beyond the perishable and imperishable; the Supreme Personality
questions.feedback: Krishna identifies Himself as the ultimate reality beyond all manifestations.

questions.prompt: 16. In BG 15.18, what is Krishna's nature as Purusottama?
choices: Supreme, beyond all and worshipable as the Absolute Truth
questions.feedback: Krishna as Purusottama is supreme, eternal, and worthy of all worship.

questions.prompt: 17. In BG 15.19 (from purport), what is the significance of knowing Krishna as Purusottama?
choices: This knowledge is the highest achievement and goal of human life
questions.feedback: Understanding Krishna as the Supreme Personality is the pinnacle of all knowledge.

questions.prompt: 18. In BG 15.1-8 (from purport), why is the cosmic tree compared to bondage?
choices: The tree represents the cycle of birth and death; attachments to material branches bind the soul
questions.feedback: The tree symbolizes material entanglement and the need to return to spiritual roots.

questions.prompt: 19. In BG 15.9-11 (from purpoint), what is the difference between kshara and akshara living entities?
choices: Kshara are temporary beings subject to change; akshara are eternal aspects of the soul
questions.feedback: All beings are eternal souls, but in material nature they experience temporary changes.

questions.prompt: 20. In BG 15.12-13 (from purport), why does Krishna control all sources of illumination?
choices: Because Krishna is the source of all energy and consciousness in the universe
questions.feedback: All light and energy manifest from Krishna's transcendental power.

questions.prompt: 21. In BG 15.5 (from purport), what weapon is needed to cut the roots of material attachment?
choices: The weapon of discrimination; knowing Krishna as supreme and renouncing attachment
questions.feedback: Knowledge and detachment are the weapons that free one from material bondage.

questions.prompt: 22. In BG 15.6-7 (from purport), what is required to reach Krishna's abode?
choices: Complete surrender and pure devotional service to Krishna
questions.feedback: Only through devotion and surrender can one reach Krishna's eternal kingdom.

questions.prompt: 23. In BG 15 (summary), what is the ultimate goal Krishna presents?
choices: Reaching Krishna as Purusottama; the Supreme Personality and ultimate destination
questions.feedback: Chapter 15 emphasizes Krishna as the ultimate reality and supreme destination.

questions.prompt: 24. In BG 15.14 (from purport), what does Krishna's role as digestive fire symbolize?
choices: Krishna's all-pervasive presence maintaining all bodily functions and life processes
questions.feedback: Krishna's presence as the life-sustaining force is universal and complete.

questions.prompt: 25. In BG 15 (overall teaching), what does understanding Purusottama accomplish?
choices: Complete knowledge of reality and the path to eternal liberation and Krishna consciousness
questions.feedback: Understanding the Purusottama is the highest knowledge and ultimate achievement.
